div.head: 逆產
div.div: , delivery of [a child in] an unnormal position

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: , delivery of [a child in] an unnormal position

sense.def: Alternative Names ni sheng 逆 生 , birth of [a child in] a position contrary to normal; dao chan 倒產 , delivery of [a child in] an inverted position; dao sheng 倒生 , birth of [a child in] inverted position. Pathological Condition of a nan chan 難產 , difficult birth, with the child entering the birth canal with its feet first. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 43: 逆產者，初覺腹痛，產時未至，驚動傷早，兒 轉未竟，便用力產之，則令逆也 , “In the case of a delivery of [a child in] an unnormal position , [the woman feels abdominal pain first. Before the delivery has begun, frightful excitement causes early damage, and the turning of the child will remain incomplete. If she then applies force to deliver it, this will cause it to move [in a position] contrary to normal”.
